issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
I notice the test  from TestDruidRecordWriter#testWrite is failing for a long time. It is releated to the issue -HIVE-15393- about guava version.

Here temporary solution  is that the label "@Ingone" is put on the test and the test is not running.
fields.summary: fix the fail test from TestDruidRecordWriter#testWrite

comments.body:
I notice [~bslim] is  investigating it.Can you have a better idea about this problem?

[~kgyrtkirk] ,can you plz take a look?

I think that just ignoring this test will make just make this problem a hidden trap....we should probably fix classpath for the tests somehow....according to maven's dependency:tree; hive-exec's guava is not on the map...but from the stack trace; I think it's there somehow...

After some further investigation it turned out that guava is not shaded in ql at all! HIVE-18668
I wonder if there are any more libraries we are "shipping" unintentionally....

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12909892/HIVE-18664.1.patch
